intro: Silaus gasparinii, commonly known as the Gasparini's silversword, is a rare and unique plant native to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its rosette growth form and silver-colored foliage. The plant produces an inflorescence of yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this rare botanical gem from invasive species and habitat loss.
